reviewText:
Didnt have a chance to play for long since I picked it up straight on release!
Why do I like this game?

1- Absolute wonderful music + arcade integration, think Guitar Hero but with beats and on your keyboad !
2- High quality original music.
3- Lightweight, works flawelessly on crossplatform on any laptop - Windows / Mac / Linux

If you like music & rythm, stop reading this review and buy this game! :)

reviewText:
Why I love this game so much ?

For the trippy music that stick into my head ?
For the vicious animations that drive me crazy ?
For the sadistic developer who brought this monster alive with so much LÖVE ?

I know why...

First, because it's intense. Either you in or either you're out, but if you're in, you'll really be in...
And second, because it made me have this particular feeling that I wasn't playing the game, but the game was playing with me.

I'm still trying to beat the third song, but the first time I played it, I couldn't help to smile ridiculously because this music and these colors made me soooo happy.

This game is full of joy, and the last song is like ecstasy.

The only drawback is that you may become dependent really fast.
There is only three songs at the moment, and once you're done with them, you'll be craving for more. But the developer said he was working on this...

reviewText: This game is GREAT! I love everything about it. The only bad thing about it it starting out, it is very difficult, but it is addictive. I would suggest a buy from anyone who likes rhythm based games or a good challange. I myself am still a noob at the time of writing. I also wish the dev woukd add stuff like customize-able backgrounds like pick your own color. all in all this is a great game and would reccommend to a friend.\n\nAny customers reading this, it for have about $4.34 USD, buy this game.

reviewText:
I just spent about a half an hour on quadrant. So, here are my first impressions.

I'm a big fan of Rhythm and Music-Based games. When I started, I was very confused as to what I was supposed to do. But as I experimented more and more, I realised how difficult it was going to get.

The gameplay is very unique. Focusing on the position of the small square while keeping in-line with the beat of the song makes for a great challenge, and each new animation that comes up just gets you nervous until you can get over it.

I can tell this is gonna be a wild ride. To the dev, more levels would be nice, but I read you're already on that. This game has TONS of potential, and I hope you realise that. Please continue to improve upon it.

I 100% recommend quadrant.

reviewText: A really good rhythm game! Most rhythm games on steam these days don't actually require you to do anything in time to the music - like AudioSurf or all the twin stick shooters, they just have music as a focal point. This game actually requires you to stick to the beat and keep track of which button to press next amidst a bunch of distractions. And the music is quite good too - there are only three levels, but it has workshop support and you can download more.
The further you get into the songs that the game provides the more it controlls you.\nikr spooky.\ngr8 game tho.
It's addictive. Once you understand how to do it, you just can't stop. I spent hours, no, days playing this. Really.

reviewText:
This game is exactly like Skyrim.
Only instead of dragons, you have squares.
Instead of swords and magic, your weapons are four buttons of anger.
Instead of experience, you gain high levels of ire towards the author.
And instead of fus ro dah, you simply want to throw your computer across the room.

reviewText:
A Minimalist Rythym Gamehttps://youtu.be/qjdONhu6t-M
+ Easy to learn, very hard to master
+ Relaxing music
+ Some trippy background effects

- A bit too hard for me
- Too simplistic, I felt like there should have been more.
- lacking content, especially considering I was only able to play 1 song because I sucked so bad

Overall though, I enjoyed it for what it was, as I'm a sucker for rythym games.
